Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Maureen Castle Tusty', 'James Tusty'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Skinner', 'Robert Chatfield', 'Bob Chitester', 'Tom Jennings'], 'Starring': ['Johan Norberg', 'Dr. Tom G. Palmer', 'Sofia Olsson Olsen'], 'Studio': ['Free To Choose Media']}
Review Text: What this movie tells us is the American political system is bogged down in politics and not working to improve our country. They, for the most part, those career politicians have lost sight of real life in America. They may never have known reality. They are not solving problems or issues. It's too slow and cumbersome. We need more control to the States and to non Government solutions. Let's start with school vouchers.
Review Title: Hits on all the important points of economics
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: Love it and learned a great deal.
Review Title: Very interesting and unique
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Call of the Forest: The Forgotten Wisdom of Trees
Review Date: 2020/10/26
Categories: Special Interest, Documentary, Feel-good, Sweet
Product Description: ['Take a walk in the woods with acclaimed Irish-Canadian scientist and author, Diana Beresford-Kroeger, as she reveals our profound human connection to the ancient & sacred northern forests and the essential role that they play in sustaining the health of our planet. Directed by Peabody-award winner Jeff McKay, and produced by Merit Motion Pictures and Edgeland Films.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeff McKay'], 'Producers': ['Merit Jensen Carr'], 'Starring': ['Diana Beresford-Kroeger']}
Review Text: We have harmed this planet in so many ways. To understand the connection between the Forest and all living things is so important for all of us. To think about how areas have been completely ravaged of their forests is horrible. I will plant a tree or two every year. We must restore our planet. It does not matter what you believe as far as climate change. We cannot live with a destroyed planet and it starts with our forests.
Review Title: Fantastic and sad at the same time. Please watch and learn. Share it too.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/10/29
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Julie Taymor'], 'Producers': ['Julie Taymor', 'Lynn Hendee'], 'Starring': ['Julianne Moore', 'Alicia Vikander', 'Timothy Hutton'], 'Studio': ['Roadside Attractions']}
Review Text: True to life as many of us in the movement did not support abortion as one of the principles. Women's health and birth control yes, but not abortion. I thank the writers for capturing this important point.  Abortion at the time was seen as an absolute LAST resort. Things need to be reevaluated now and provide far improved supports for women who choose life. Pro-life IS Pro Women.
Review Title: I enjoyed this movie because it really caught the essence of the movement
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

    Structure your response as:
   
    SUMMARY:
    [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a strong preference for high-quality, emotionally resonant films, as demonstrated by consistently high ratings, with several titles scoring above 4.5. A recurrent theme is the appreciation for compelling narratives and strong performances, especially in genres like drama, suspense, and documentaries that tackle important social issues. The person enjoys films that incorporate elements of realism, poignancy, and often highlight moral or environmental lessons.

Their sentiment is predominantly positive, with multiple reviews reflecting enthusiasm for well-crafted storytelling and ethical themes. While there are occasional critiques, they frequently express satisfaction, suggesting a low tolerance for mediocrity and an inclination towards high production standards. 

Price sensitivity appears minimal; there's no evident pattern of reluctance to invest in diverse genres or potentially higher-cost documentaries, indicating a willingness to prioritize quality over price. However, they have also shown some tolerance for low-budget films as long as they provide something of interest or educational value.

Overall, this person values rich cinematic experiences that offer depth, social commentary, and emotional impact, positioning them as a discerning viewer keen on meaningful content.

target_interaction.title: I would have liked more examples
target_interaction.text: I felt this was all about the author's opinions and not factual examples.
